title: Cash Genie to pay fleeced customers more than £20m
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Cash Genie to pay fleeced customers more than £20m Serious failings included charging customers a £50 fee to transfer debts to a collection agency even though it cost them nothing Gareth Fuller/PA Google+ 1 of 1 Serious failings included charging customers a £50 fee to transfer debts to a collection agency even though it cost them nothing Gareth Fuller/PA Miles Costello   28 2015 
A payday lender that admitted to hitting its customers with a string of unfair fees and charges has agreed to pay more than £20 million in compensation to tens of thousands of people who were fleeced. 
Cash Genie, which is operated by Ariste Holding, was guilty of a number of “serious failings” dating back to its creation in September 2009, according to the Financial Conduct Authority, which helped to put together the redress scheme. 
These included charging customers a £50 fee when it transferred their debts to its collection agency, Twyford Developments, even though moving them cost Cash Genie nothing. Subscribe now
